pull.title: Simplify "bool x = y ? true : false". Remove unused function and trailing semicolon.
pull.body:
Three minor cleanups:
* Simplify `bool x = y ? true : false` to `bool x = y`
* Remove unused function `InsecureRandBytes(size_t len)`
* Remove accidental trailing semicolon

events.message: Simplify "bool x = y ? true : false" to "bool x = y"

events.body: @laanwj Good point! Now using the suggested `bool(mine & ISMINE_SPENDABLE)` form.

comments.body:
Wouldn't simply `bool(mine & ISMINE_SPENDABLE)` work? I don't think we really want to re-interpret the value as a bool here, but instantiate a bool with the value `!=0`. I know static_cast doesn't reinterpret values, but it seems ugly...
Speaking of which, this could even be `(mine & ISMINE_SPENDABLE) != 0`?
